frame.name: Bond_maturation
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Financial_instrument</fen> (a bond or insurance) fulfills a condition at a certain <fen>Time</fen> after which the <fen>Issuer</fen> of the <fen>Financial_instrument</fen> is legally obligated to pay the <fen>Holder</fen> a monetary <fen>Value</fen>, based on the instrument's original <fen>Principle</fen> and the <fen>Interest</fen> rate.
<ex>The bond had matured to its full value at 30 years.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Financial_instrument
FE.definition:
<def-root>The bond, insurance, or debt security which a Holder buys from an Issuer.
<ex><fex name="Financial_instrument">West Shore Railroad bonds</fex> never <t>mature</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>When the <fen>Financial_instrument</fen> reaches maturity.
<ex>Treasury bonds <t>mature</t> <fex name="Time">after 30 years</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Issuer
FE.definition: <def-root>The entity which is obligated to pay the <fen>Holder</fen> after the <fen>Financial_instrument</fen> matures.</def-root>

FE.name: Holder
FE.definition: <def-root>The entity which owns the <fen>Financial_instrument</fen> and is owed money from the <fen>Issuer</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Value
FE.definition:
<def-root>What the <fen>Financial_instrument</fen> is worth after maturity.
<ex>The bond <t>matured</t><fex name="Value">to the full amount</fex> in 2009.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Principle
FE.definition: <def-root>The amount that the <fen>Holder</fen> originally paid to own the <fen>Financial_instrument</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Interest
FE.definition: <def-root>The growth rate on the <fen>Principle</fen> that results in the final <fen>Value</fen> of the <fen>Financial_instrument</fen>.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: maturity.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a debt security's state of being due for payment

lexUnit.name: endow.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: having conditions fulfilled obligating payment
